title: Quantum Optimal Transport: Quantum Channels and Qubits
abstract: These notes are based on the lectures given by the second author at the School on Optimal Transport on Quantum Structures at Erd√∂s Center in September 2022. The focus of the exposition is on two recently introduced approaches on quantum optimal transport: one based on quantum channels as generalized transport plans, the other based on the notion of Hamming-Wasserstein distance of order 1 on multiple-qubit systems. The material is presented in an elementary manner with a focus on the finite-dimensional setting.
journal_ref: In: Maas, J., Rademacher, S., Titkos, T., Virosztek, D. (eds) Optimal Transport on Quantum Structures. Bolyai Society Mathematical Studies, vol 29 (2024). Springer, Cham
